com.esplibrary.bluetooth

Interface IV1connectionWrapper

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    V1connectionBaseWrapper, V1connectionDemoWrapper, V1connectionLEWrapper, V1connectionWrapper

    public interface IV1connectionWrapper
    Interface to operate a V1 Bluetooth device.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getDataTimeout

        long getDataTimeout()
        Returns the ESP data timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        ESP data timeout

      • setDataTimeout

        void setDataTimeout(long timeoutMillis)
        Set's the ESP data timeout
        Parameters:
        timeoutMillis - Timeout in milliseconds

      • getValentineType

        DeviceId getValentineType()
        Returns the type of the attached V1. If disconnected, or no V1 attached this value will be DeviceId.UNKNOWN_DEVICE.
        Returns:
        The type of the attached V1.

      • getConnectionType

        ConnectionType getConnectionType()
        ConnectionType of the wrapper
        Returns:
        Connection type

      • getDevice

        android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice getDevice()
        BluetoothDevice this wrapper will establish a connection with
        Returns:
        Connection device

      • getCachedRSSI

        int getCachedRSSI()
        Returns the last read RSSI for the connected remote BLE device. If no connection a value of '-127' will always be returned.
        Returns:
        The last read RSSI value.
        See Also:
        readRemoteRSSI(RSSICallback)

      • readRemoteRSSI

        boolean readRemoteRSSI(RSSICallback callback)
        Asynchronously reads the connected remote BLE devices RSSI and invokes callback once the value has been read.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback that will be invoked with the read back RSSI value.
        Returns:
        True if an Asynchronously read has taken place. If false is returned, check the log output for a hint as to why the call failed.

      • connect

        void connect(android.content.Context ctx,
             android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device)
        Asynchronosly attempts to establish a connection with device.
        Parameters:
        device - the target Bluetooth device to connect.

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(boolean notifyDisconnect)
        Disconnects from the currently connected V1.
        Parameters:
        notifyDisconnect -

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Indicates if there is a connection.
        Returns:
        True if connected.

      • isConnecting

        boolean isConnecting()
        Indicate if a connection is being established.
        Returns:
        True if connection is established. If connected, this value returns false.

      • protectLegacyMode

        void protectLegacyMode(boolean protect)
        Controls if ESP data should be sent while operating in Legacy mode.
        Parameters:
        protect - True if ESP data shouldn't be sent while in legacy mode.

      • setDemoData

        void setDemoData(java.lang.String demoData)
        Set's the dummy ESP data to be used while operating in Demo mode.
        Parameters:
        demoData - String ESP data

      • repeatDemoMode

        void repeatDemoMode(boolean repeat)
        Controls whether demo data should be repeated from start once the end is reached.
        Parameters:
        repeat - True if the data should be repeated.

      • addRequest

        void addRequest(ESPRequest request)
        Add an packet to be sent
        Parameters:
        request - The packet to be sent.

      • addRequest

        void addRequest(ESPRequest request,
                boolean nextToSend)
        Add an packet to be sent.
        Parameters:
        request - The packet to be sent.
        nextToSend - True if the packet should be pushed to the front of the send queue so that it's the very next packet sent.

      • setESPClientListener

        void setESPClientListener(ESPClientListener listener)
        Register a listener to be invoked when ESP data has been received.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener that will be invoked.

      • clearESPClientListener

        void clearESPClientListener()
        Removes the registered listener.

      • addConnectionListener

        void addConnectionListener(ConnectionListener listener)
        Add a listener for connection events.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener that will be invoked.

      • removeConnectionListener

        void removeConnectionListener(ConnectionListener listener)
        Remove a listener for connection events. The listener will receive no further notifications of connection events.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove.

      • clearConnectionListeners

        void clearConnectionListeners()
        Removes all connection event listeners.

      • setMalformedListener

        void setMalformedListener(MalformedDataListener listener)
        Register a listener to be invoked when bad ESP data has been received.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener that will be invoked.

      • clearMalformedListener

        void clearMalformedListener()
        Clears the registered listener. The listener will receive no further notifications of bad ESP data.

      • setNoDataListener

        void setNoDataListener(NoDataListener listener)
        Register a listener to be invoked when ESP data hasn't been detected.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener that will be invoked.
        See Also:
        getDataTimeout()

      • clearNoDataListener

        void clearNoDataListener()
        Clears the registered listener. The listener will receive no further notifications of no ESP data detection.

      • setNotificationListener

        void setNotificationListener(NotificationListener listener)
        Register a listener to be invoked when Notification data has been received.

        Note: This callback will be invoked on main (UI) thread.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener that will be invoked.

      • clearNotificationListener

        void clearNotificationListener()
        Clears the registered listener. The listener will receive no further notification data.

      • setWriteListener

        void setWriteListener(ESPWriteListener writeListener)
        Register a listener to be invoked when ESP data has been sent.
        Parameters:
        writeListener - The listener that will be invoked when ESP data is written

      • clearWriteListener

        void clearWriteListener()
        Clears the registered ESPWriteListener.
